content.question: Which of the following represents a primary difference in how Europeans conducted trade in the Atlantic region compared to how they conducted trade in Asia in the period 1450â€“1750 ?

choices.label: While European trade in the Atlantic was based on mercantilist policies, Europeans engaged in free trade and promoted freedom of the seas in Asia.
While European trade in the Americas relied upon the extraction and circulation of silver, silver was not a significant medium of exchange in the Asian markets.
While European trade in the Americas was generally peaceful, European navies overthrew large established empires in Asia.
While European trade in the Americas involved extensive conquest and colonization, Europeans primarily concentrated on transporting goods between Asian regions.

content.answer: While European trade in the Americas involved extensive conquest and colonization, Europeans primarily concentrated on transporting goods between Asian regions.

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
